item.title: Style Guides go Beyond Aesthetics
item.description: Oftentimes we witness the results of elitist practices upon users, usually worded in the form of the acronym RTFM or “Read The Freaking Manual”. User manuals have their place, but up to which point can we expect users to learn by reading instead of doing? A similar stigma often appears in Free Software / Open Source projects as well. The alternative “Read the Documentation” certainly would ensure that people would give a little more effort before repeating questions.
